title: PCOS Prevalence
content: PCOS affects 1 in 10 women of reproductive age worldwide, making it one of the most common hormonal disorders.

title: PCOS Only Affects Overweight Women
myth: Only overweight women can have PCOS
reality: PCOS affects women of all body types. While weight can worsen symptoms, lean women can also have PCOS.

title: Insulin Resistance Connection
content: Up to 70% of women with PCOS have insulin resistance, which can lead to weight gain and difficulty losing weight.

title: PCOS Means You Can't Get Pregnant
myth: Women with PCOS can't get pregnant naturally
reality: While PCOS can make conception more challenging, many women with PCOS do conceive naturally or with treatment.

title: Long-term Health Risks
content: Women with PCOS have increased risk of type 2 diabetes, heart disease, and endometrial cancer if left untreated.

title: Birth Control is the Only Treatment
myth: Birth control pills are the only treatment for PCOS
reality: PCOS treatment is comprehensive and may include lifestyle changes, medications, supplements, and various therapies.

title: Lifestyle Impact
content: Lifestyle modifications including diet and exercise can improve insulin sensitivity and reduce PCOS symptoms by up to 50%.

title: PCOS is Just Irregular Periods
reality: PCOS can cause acne, hair loss, excess hair growth, weight gain, mood changes, and metabolic issues beyond irregular periods.

title: Early Diagnosis Benefits
content: Early diagnosis and treatment of PCOS can prevent long-term complications and improve quality of life significantly.

title: You Need Ovarian Cysts for PCOS
myth: You must have ovarian cysts to be diagnosed with PCOS
reality: Despite the name, you don't need ovarian cysts for PCOS diagnosis. Many women with PCOS don't have visible cysts.
